title: The 2016 Diabetes World Summit, 18-24th April 2016
description:
The 2016 Diabetes World Summit will help you understand and address:

+ The root causes of all forms of diabetes and how to address them
+ How to prevent and stop the progression of diabetes
+ 10 of the most important strategies to help reverse type 2 diabetes
+ The optimal diet to prevent, control and reverse type 2 diabetes
+ Most effective forms of exercise for optimal blood sugar control
+ Latest insights into understanding and correcting metabolic problems

Day 1: Monday, April 18
Jonny Bowden, PhD, CNS - Using 'Smart Fat' to Balance Blood Sugar
Deanna Minich, PhD - A Mind/Body Approach to Better Blood Sugar Control
Jody Stanislaw, ND - 3 Essentials to Lowering HbA1c Readings
Dr. Peter Osborne - Grain-Free Living for Optimal Health
Eric Westman, MD - The Low Carb, High Fat Diet for Diabetes

Day 2: Tuesday, April 19
Lily Nichols, RDN, CDE, CLT - A Real Food Approach to Gestational Diabetes
Dr. Daniel Kalish - The Mitochondria and Metabolism
Mike Mutzel, MSc - How the Gut Affects Metabolic Health
Sarah Ballantyne, PhD - The Importance of Sleep for Blood Sugar Health
Datis Kharrazian, DHSc, DC, FACN, CNS - New Scientific Insights into the Diabetes Continuum

Day 3: Wednesday, April 20
John Dempster, ND - How Mental Health Affects Blood Sugar and Diabetes
Franziska Spritzler, RD, CDE - Exposing Common Diabetes Myths
William Curtis, MD - Diabetes Care from the Trenches
Donna Gates, MEd, ABAAHP - Importance of Optimal Blood Sugar for Body Ecology
Mira and Jayson Calton, PhD - The Micronutrient Miracle for Blood Sugar Balance

Day 4: Thursday, April 21
Dr. Josh Axe - 5 Keys To Reversing Type 2 Diabetes
JJ Virgin - How to Break Sugar Cravings
Izabella Wentz, PharmD - How Hashimotoâ€™s and Hypothyroidism Affect Blood Sugar
Steven Masley, MD - A Heart Specialistâ€™s Perspective on Type 2 Diabetes

Day 5: Friday, April 22
Dr. Eric Zielinski - Essential Oils for Blood Sugar Balance
Dr. Trevor Cates - Diabetes and the Skin
Alan Christianson, NMD - The Adrenals and Diabetes
Sara Gottfried, MD - How to Balance Hormones for Better Blood Sugar
Pedram Shojai, OMD - The Urban Monk on Diabetes

Day 6: Saturday, April 23
Dan Ritchie, PhD - How to Age Functionally
James Maskell - Is Diabetes a Social Genomic Phenomenon?
Andrea Nakayama, CNE, CHHC, CNC - A Functional Approach to Nutrition for Blood Sugar
Dr. Eric Berg - The Adrenal Fatigue Connection to Diabetes
Robert Lustig, MD - What Is Driving the Global Diabetes Pandemic?

Day 7: Sunday, April 24
Leanne Vogel, Holistic Nutritionist - The Power to End Food Obsession
Ben Greenfield, MS - Bio-hacking Blood Sugar
Suzy Cohen, RPh - A Pharmacistâ€™s Perspective on Solving the Type 2 Diabetes Crisis
Mark Hyman, MD - How to Lose Weight and Improve Blood Sugar by Eating Fat

This is critical information concerning the long term health of diabetics and should be freely available to the public. Please share and seed generously to keep this torrent alive for years to come. 

Downloaded from http://thediabetessummit.com/ on Monday, April 25, 2016
